heading: mp3.com signs tori and alanis
subheading: the mp3 content distributor will announce agreements this week with divas tori amos and alanis morissette. mp3.com is said to be spinning more deals with major artists.
author: wired news report
text: alanis morissette and tori amos will announce alliances this week with mp3.com, as well as tour sponsorships and promotions by best buy, according to a  usa today report.the report says morissette will post songs on mp3.com that were recorded live on her tour, and that she may take a stake in the young company.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coveragebrowse webmonkey's mp3 guide- - - - - -it is unclear how the pop singers' labels are connected with the deal. both singers are represented by time warner labels. morissette's tour kicks off on 18 august in fort lauderdale, florida.mp3.com is set to announce several high-profile deals on wednesday with atlas/third rail, a los angeles-based film, music, and personal management company that represents recording artists goo goo dolls, green day, luscious jackson, seal, and weezer. the announcement is expected to be one of the first significant alliances between an online digital music company and a traditional entertainment company.
